channel.title: [317][wL] Packet #241

item.title: [317][wL] Packet #241
item.dc:creator: @z z
item.description:
@z wrote:

I’m having trouble sending packet 241 which is used for a secondary map region. I want to determine how to load multiple regions at once, but I am having trouble doing so. I am currently getting an IndexArrayOutOfBoundsException on the “writeFrameSizeWord” function, but the client will crash if I do not include this.

Here is my current code:

outStream.createFrame(241); //outStream.writeWord(0); //ofs = outStream.currentOffset; outStream.writeWordA((mapRegionY + 6)); outStream.initBitAccess(); for(int z = 0; z < 4; z++) { for(int x = 0; x < 13; x++) { for(int y = 0; y < 13; y++) { outStream.writeBits(1, 1); outStream.writeBits(26, (3200 / 8) << 14 | (3200 / 8) << 3 | (z % 4) << 24 | (0 % 4) << 1); } } } outStream.finishBitAccess(); outStream.writeWord(mapRegionX); //outStream.writeFrameSizeWord(outStream.currentOffeset - ofs);

As you may have noticed, there is a writeFrameSizeWord() and currentOffset functionality, but I am unsure if I need it.

Thanks.

Read full topic
